p: The cases with clinical manifestations and that are positive in at least one of the following pathogen detections can be defined as influenza: (1) nucleic acid detection of influenza virus, (2) rapid antigen detection of influenza virus which should be combined with epidemiological history, (3) isolation and culture of influenza virus, and (4) specific IgG antibody of influenza virus in double sera from acute stage and convalescence stage showing an increase of above four times.
